PR Account Manager

Company Name Civic Reputation Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 64 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Civic Reputation, part of The Civic Group group of agencies, specialises in integrated communications solutions that deliver measurable results. We bring the advantage of local and international experience, delivering campaigns for some of the world’s most recognisable and respected brands. Our approach combines the full-service capabilities and strategic depth of a global network, with the agility and commitment to service of a boutique agency. This means we put our clients’ reputation first, with impactful creative campaigns underpinned by insight, strategic thinking and meticulous planning. Our goal is to be a trusted partner to our clients, and deliver results that exceed expectations.

\xa0

We have an immediate opening for a media and digital savvy individual with strong property PR experience to join our growing practice.

\xa0

As a PR Account Manager, the successful candidate will play a key role in managing key client relationships, assisting with the development and execution of communications programs, maintaining relationships with key media and online influencers, thinking strategically and creatively on behalf of clients, and supporting new business initiatives.


The candidate for the PR Account Manager role must have:

  • Excellent writing skills with experience writing effective content (social posts, press releases, by-lined articles and case studies) for media and social channels.
  • Solid reporting and presentation skills

  • Strong understanding of social media platforms and best practices.

  • Strong client relations skills.

  • Must have the ability to work autonomously

Digital Director

Company Name S2M Digital Recruitment Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 125 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Digital Director
Melbourne
$100000 - $115000 package

You will have a rare opportunity to join a leading full service agency based in Melbourne in this Digital Director\xa0job. \xa0This award-winning company that has an impeccable reputation and an enviable client list; this integrated environment is not only a highly sought after place to work, it also nurtures professional development and provides a great place to progress in your career during this period of growth for the business.

You will have the opportunity to demonstrate your leadership expertise by ensuring your talented team is given the instruction and guidance they need in order to continually grow the company and its brand. You will take the lead on one key client, spending most of your time nurturing this relationship. You will lead digital strategy (across paid search, paid social and programmatic) across BAU and campaigns, ensuring high performance and output from the team across key digital acquisition channels. You will manage and develop the Digital team, ensuring they are up-to-speed across media and technology developments.

You will come from a strong multi-channel Performance background, with exceptional client management skills. You will be confident and articulate with a strong interest in keeping abreast of digital advancements. You will have experience of managing premium clients and will enjoy an environment where you can really make a difference. Although senior level experience at Director level would be preferable, Senior Managers will also be considered.

This opportunity is unique, as an\xa0Digital Director\xa0you will not only exemplify the companies brand you will also manifest its business goals of growth. You will have the opportunity to join a leading full service agency during a rapid period of growth for the business. You will be working with a friendly and likable team and will really have the opportunity to become embedded within a client's business. In return, you will receive between $100000 - $115000 package and will have real opportunities for progression within the business.

If this job role sounds like it might be a great fit for you please follow the link to apply for the job. If you would like to refer a friend or to have a confidential discussion regarding your job search please contact Sarah Gillespie on sarah.gillespie@s2m.com.au . S2M Digital offer a referral bonus of $400 in Flight Centre vouchers for successful candidates referrals (T&C’s apply) so please do not hesitate to get in touch.

A driving force in sales, running and contributing in marketing campaigns, champion of policies and procedures and managing day to day customer service. \xa0

  • Sales for the Properties
  • Reservations at the Properties

Executive Manager - Distribution

Company Name WillowBlue Consulting Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 52 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Newly created Executive role reporting to CEO
  • Join one of Australia’s Award-Winning Industry Superannuation funds \xa0
  • Key player in driving the Fund’s strategic growth initiatives

\xa0

Located in Melbourne, our client has a strong sense of purpose, clear vision, pragmatic strategies and emotionally compelling goals that will inspire you to be part of their journey and envisioned future. \xa0With a long-standing history in the Industry Fund sector and big aspirations for their future, they are the trusted partner working on behalf of some of the hardest working superannuants in Australia. \xa0Committed to building a respected, high performing and progressive Fund, our client recognises the key to achieving their corporate goals will only be made possible through its people and hiring the right talent that will work best in their team and unique environment. \xa0

\xa0

A strategic thinker and influential leader, reporting directly to the CEO, you will:

\xa0

  • Lead the delivery of the Fund’s strategic approach to organic growth.
  • Actively contribute to a cohesive and collegiate Leadership team and foster a culture of empowerment.
  • Use your member advocacy and insight to develop innovative solutions tailored to the Fund’s demographic that enables growth and retention outcomes.
  • Implement growth activities across member facing teams to deliver on the Fund’s objectives. \xa0
  • Grow, develop and uplift the capability of your team in accordance with the Fund’s values and goals.
  • Implement technologies that are fit for purpose, deliver value and maximise the Fund’s opportunity to achieve their business objectives through innovative solutions.
  • Ensure a service delivery experience to members and employers that reflect the Fund’s values and goals.
  • Work cross-functionally within the business to ensure seamless service delivery to members and employers.
  • Build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders respecting the history and inter-dependencies.

\xa0

You will already have significant leadership experience in a superannuation and/or financial services environment, with a proven track record of delivering growth targets and commercial outcomes. \xa0You will be keen to sponsor key projects that enable technology to deliver innovative solutions. \xa0You are committed to meaningful and purposeful work that genuinely makes a difference in people’s lives. You enjoy building effective stakeholder relationships to confidently influence and impact decision-making.

\xa0

Reasons for joining our client

\xa0

  • You will be joining the growth sector of superannuation and working with members and employers.
  • There is a robust culture that is authentically lived by the Leadership team.
  • The Fund is undergoing a major transformation journey to modernise the Fund. You will play an integral role in creating value for their members. Members are at the core of decision-making.
  • Our client recognises that the best way to develop the Fund is to develop its people by helping them grow and enhance their potential. \xa0They invest in technical and soft skill development through offering of on-going education and training. You will also attend industry conferences and be given access to highly credible and experienced industry professionals.
  • \xa0A real opportunity to make a difference and create value to ordinary Australians for dignity in retirement.
  • You will be joining an organisation with a people first mentality. Our client recognises the contribution of its employees and rewards their staff with a dedicated range of attractive benefits. \xa0There is a genuine commitment to work/life balance.

\xa0

What you bring to the role

\xa0

  • Relevant tertiary qualifications in business or commerce, plus post-graduate qualifications preferable.
  • Strong work ethic and resilience to overcome challenges with a pragmatic approach.
  • Proven people leadership capability including managing, coaching and developing staff members.
  • Exceptional soft skills to build strong internal/external relationships with excellent presentation capability.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills to present at all levels including Board & C-level executives.
  • Excellent organisational skills to meet deadlines with the ability to effectively prioritise and juggle multiple tasks.

\xa0

Next Steps

If you would like to have a confidential discussion to learn more about this role, please contact ROZ SHAW on 0457 120 550 or 8679 4150 or alternatively to be considered for this role “APPLY NOW” with your resume and covering letter (in Word format only).

\xa0

You must have full rights to work in Australia to be considered for this opportunity.

\xa0

\xa0

Information Security Compliance Analyst

Company Name Lexer Company Location 86 Inkerman St St Kilda, Melbourne, VIC 3182, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 112 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Lexer -\xa0Information Security Compliance Analyst

Lexer is a\xa0Customer Data Platform.\xa0 We load, summarise and enhance client data and make it available in SaaS platforms for marketing, service and research.


We're growing really quickly.\xa0 We have a team of 50 talented people spread across Melbourne (HQ), Sydney, Los Angeles and New York.\xa0 We work with a bunch of leading global brands.


Information security is our core business.\xa0 We have a robust INFOSEC environment and we're ISO 27001:2013 certified and SOC 2 audited.\xa0 But we need more help...


We're looking for a part-time resource to help maintain our internal INFOSEC policies / processes as well as interface with clients and auditors.\xa0 We need a grown-up with strong interpersonal skills and a background in INFOSEC compliance.


About the role/workplace:


  • Minimum 1-day per week, but up to 3-days per week in peak work periods (e.g. during audits).\xa0 We'll pay the extra days monthly in arrears using timesheet data.
  • Office location - St Kilda, Vic (no overseas / interstate applicants please)
  • Flexible work hours - Work from home and outside normal business hours as required
  • Reporting to the CFO / ISO
  • Fun and friendly environment


About the work:


  • Maintain and update policies & procedures
  • Train staff on correct application of documented internal controls
  • Present ISMS Awareness Training (to new hires and annually to relevant staff)
  • Perform internal audits
  • Manage ISO and SOC 2 audit process
  • Respond to staff on INFOSEC related questions
  • Respond to client INFOSEC Questionnaires (managed to a successful outcome)


Looking forward to hearing from you.
